question.title: If Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This announcement must be definitive, unambiguous, and made publicly by Biden or his campaign, leaving no possibility of him accepting the nomination for the 2024 election.

Given this, will Kamala Harris's Electoral College probability in Nate Silver's model be greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM? Resolves YES if it is >46.6% at that time, and NO otherwise.

This analysis considers the impact of Biden's decision on Harris's perceived chances in the model, as tracked on Nate Silver's platform.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden declare that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination, will Kamala Harris's chances of victory improve according to Nate Silver's projections?
para_P.body:
Assume the following scenario: Joe Biden publicly states before July 15, 2024, that he will not seek the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This declaration must be clear, unequivocal, and made by Biden or his campaign, eliminating any chance of him running for the 2024 election.

In light of this, will Kamala Harris's likelihood of winning in the Electoral College, as per Nate Silver's projections, exceed 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM? The resolution is YES if it is greater than 46.6% at that moment, and NO otherwise.

This evaluation examines how Biden's choice influences Harris's estimated probabilities in the model, as monitored on Nate Silver's platform.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

The exclusion or prevention is verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media coverage. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be deemed "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen *after* the specified date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded or prevented from a ballot and then reinstated, resulting in him not being excluded or prevented from any ballot as of July 15, the question will resolve negatively.

This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention must be substantiated by official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be answered with "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or later changes that may happen after the specified date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the specified conditions as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or prevented from any ballot, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

question.title: Given Donald Trump is removed or blocked from a primary ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will he be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as of July 15, 2024. This removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports, and is not reversed by that date.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump will be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? The resolution is based on the decision made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of the eventual outcome of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and (2) Donald Trump is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met:

1. As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. Note that the question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

2. Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

The question will resolve as "No" if either or both of these conditions are not met.

The identity of the individual who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 U.S. election is irrelevant; the determination is solely based on who is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

The question will resolve as "No" if either or both of these conditions are not fulfilled.

question.title: If Joe Biden dies before Saturday, will he remain President through the end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden dies before Saturday, with an official announcement of his death made before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, resolves NO.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., appointing his Vice President as the Acting President) does not lead to a YES resolution. (The Acting President is not the same as the President according to the Constitution)

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been formally disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention must be verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable news reports. Speculative information, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be answered with "No" if these criteria are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or any subsequent changes that may take place after the specified date. It solely concerns whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. question.title: Given Donald Trump is removed from any primary ballot under the 14th Amendment, will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as confirmed by official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports, by July 15, 2024. This does not consider legal battles, appeals, or reversals after this date.

Then, will Ted Cruz be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This is determined solely by the selection of the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

Provided that the following is accurate: Donald Trump has been formally disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal office according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as confirmed by official announcements from state authorities, court decisions, legal documents, or credible news outlets, by July 15, 2024. This scenario does not take into account any legal challenges, appeals, or reversals that might take place after this date.

In this situation, will Ted Cruz be selected by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 U.S. Presidential Election? This determination relies solely on the decisions made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is nominated on the day of the 2024 U.S. election.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met:

1. As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, this condition is not met.

2. Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The resolution of this condition is based solely on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

The question will resolve as "No" if either or both of these conditions are not met.

By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal role (President, Senate, House of Representatives) according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This disqualification must be confirmed through official announcements from state authorities, court decisions, legal documents, or reliable news sources. Speculative writings, opinion pieces, or unofficial remarks will not be deemed adequate. The inquiry does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may occur after the specified date. It strictly evaluates whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal role based on the aforementioned criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot but is later reinstated, meaning that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or barred from any ballot, this condition is not satisfied.

2. Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 U.S. Presidential Election. The satisfaction of this condition is determined only by the decisions made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is declared as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 U.S. election.

The response will be "No" if either or both of these conditions are not satisfied.

question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

This question will receive a **Yes** response if Donald Trump Jr. is appointed by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 U.S. Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No** answer. This inquiry is not restricted to currently mentioned candidates; new options may emerge in the future.

For this question, it is irrelevant who secures the Republican nomination on the date of the 2024 U.S. election; the conclusion is exclusively based on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will at least five named Democratic House Representatives or Senators press Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly called for Biden to step aside. Two of the most vulnerable Democrats have indicated to local media that they no longer believe Biden can win in November.

Behind the scenes, the situation is even more hectic. There are several drafts of letters being circulated among House Democrats, and at least one is intended to urge Biden to conclude his campaign, as reported by five individuals familiar with these activities.

This market will resolve to YES if a collective of at least five named Democratic Party US House Representatives or US Senators collaborate to ask Joe Biden to reflect on ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could occur through signing a letter as mentioned above, or through another method such as a group meeting with Biden in person and jointly requesting him to withdraw.

This market stipulates that all five individuals must be part of the same unified message. If five individuals independently express to reporters their belief that Biden should withdraw, it will not be sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden with a request for him to step aside will not meet this market's requirements unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the market's closing date. In cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond reasonable doubt, the market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not fulfilled before July 20th, the market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Given at least 5 Democratic lawmakers pressure Biden to drop out before July 20, will he announce not accepting the nomination before July 15, 2024?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Resolution criteria for the outcome:

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.body:
Resolution criteria for the condition: If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, the New York Times shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out, the condition is met. Otherwise, it is not.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

question.title: Conditional on Taylor Swift's cameo, will Deadpool & Wolverine have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Taylor Swift appears in the movie 'Deadpool and Wolverine' in any role, even if it is just her voice used for a character. This will still be considered true even if she is not credited on IMDB, as long as it is confirmed by independent sources.

Then, will 'Deadpool & Wolverine' have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie? Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for the "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie. The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

The record for the biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M globally ($152.2M domestic). This market will resolve YES if 'Deadpool x Wolverine' grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release.

In summary, if Taylor Swift cameos in the movie, will it break the record for the biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie?

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

This announcement must be definitive, public, and official, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination in the 2024 election cycle. Given this scenario, will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election? question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, and (b) the Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

(b) Will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?

This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Joe Biden makes an announcement before July 15, 2024, stating he will not run for the Democratic nomination for President, and (b) the Republican Party keeps control of Ohio's 6th congressional district in the special election of 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Is Joe Biden going to declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This inquiry will be answered with Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that he will not seek nor accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. For a Yes resolution, the statement must be straightforward and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the upcoming 2024 election cycle. question.title: Conditional on Israel carrying out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, will Iran's Guardian Council approve Mahmoud Ahmadinejad as a presidential candidate?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Israel carries out an attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, leading to the death of at least five individuals, as indicated by credible reports. Then, will Iran's Guardian Council include Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name on its list of approved candidates for president of Iran? This question resolves **Yes** if Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election. question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20, 2024, and (b) Will Hurd is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time, this part will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.
(b) This part will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this part, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(a) This segment will be marked as yes if Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to proceed in the race before July 20, 2024, at midnight Eastern Time. If not, it will be marked as no.
(b) This segment will be marked as **Yes** if Will Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be marked as **No**. This question is open to candidates not currently listed; additional options may be introduced later.

For this segment, the identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is not pertinent; it will be determined solely by the choice made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

For this aspect, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; the outcome is strictly based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

Resolution should cite credible media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden still hold the presidency until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden is still the US President at the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that time.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not lead to a YES resolution. (The role of Acting President is distinct from that of President according to the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden still hold the presidency until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This question resolves to YES if Biden continues to be the President of the United States until the end of July 2024 (ET); it resolves to NO if he steps down, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as the Acting President) does not result in a YES resolution. (The role of Acting President is distinct from that of President according to the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden remain in office as President until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will result in a YES if Biden remains the President of the United States through the end of July 2024 (ET); it will yield a NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President prior to that date.

A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (like designating his Vice President as the Acting President) does not lead to a YES outcome. (The position of Acting President is separate from that of President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden continue to hold the presidency until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if Biden is still the US President at the conclusion of July 2024 (ET); it resolves to NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date.

A temporary handover of power as per the 25th amendment (such as designating his Vice President as the Acting President) does not result in a YES resolution. (The role of Acting President is distinct from that of President according to the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden remain in the presidency until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be considered YES if Biden is still serving as the US President at the end of July 2024 (ET); it will be NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before that date.

question.title: If Biden remains President through July 2024, will Trump be removed from any state ballot under 14th Amendment Section 3?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden remains the President of the United States through the end of July 2024. This means he does not resign, die, or otherwise cease to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th Amendment, making his VP the Acting President, does not affect this status.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump will be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment? This resolves as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. The resolution is "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question strictly pertains to the status as of July 15, 2024, and does not consider legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals after this date. If Trump is removed or blocked and then reinstated such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Given the EU announces new tariffs on Chinese EVs before July 5, 2024, will at least 5 Dem House Members or Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024?
question.body:
This question explores the potential link between two political events. Suppose the following is true: Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles. Given this scenario, is it true that a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators will work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

For the outcome to resolve as YES:
- The EU must announce new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024.
- At least five named Democratic House Members or Senators must collectively pressure Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024, through a group action, such as signing a letter or a collective in-person request.

If either of these conditions is not met, the question resolves NO.

para_P.title: If the EU implements new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles prior to July 5, 2024, will a minimum of five Democratic Members of the House or Senate exert pressure on Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the possible connection between two political occurrences. Assume the following holds true: Before July 5, 2024, reliable sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has put forth new tariffs or duties on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles. Given this situation, is it accurate to say that a coalition of at least five specified Democratic Party members from the US House or US Senate will collaborate to request Joe Biden to contemplate ceasing his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

For the answer to be YES:
- The EU must unveil new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles ahead of July 5, 2024.
- A group of at least five identified Democratic House Members or Senators must jointly pressure Biden to withdraw before July 20, 2024, through a collective action, such as signing a letter or making a group in-person appeal.

If either of these criteria is not fulfilled, the resolution will be NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) the EU announce new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024, and (2) at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024?
question.body:
(1) The first condition will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(2) The second condition will resolve as **Yes** if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter, as reported, or in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will FiveThirtyEight indicate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will determine a “Yes” outcome if Joe Biden is projected to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will result in a “No” if Donald Trump is forecasted to have a higher likelihood of winning than Joe Biden on that same date. In the event that both candidates are shown to have equal probabilities, the market will resolve at 50-50.

The source for resolution will be the FiveThirtyEight 2024 presidential election forecast, accessible at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically utilizing the values indicated by the blue and red trend lines on the resolution date. Any alterations to the methods used by FiveThirtyEight to calculate these figures will not affect the resolution of this market.

question.title: Will Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Given Liz Cheney is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and not by who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

Then, is it true that the Republican Party will retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election? This resolves as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.title: If Liz Cheney is chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will the Republican Party keep control of Ohio's 6th congressional district in the special election of 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: Liz Cheney is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is made exclusively by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and not based on who is nominated on election day.

Then, can we say that the Republican Party will maintain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election? This is affirmed as Yes if reliable sources indicate that a candidate from the Republican Party has secured victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In case of conflicting reports from popular sources, a statement or source from Ohio State will be referenced. If there is no election conducted before January 1, 2025, the question will be considered void.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement declaring that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

question.title: Conditional on Kamala Harris becoming President or Acting President by July 26, 2024, will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. This determination will be based on official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting.

Then, is the following true? Joe Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). This resolves YES if he remains President, and NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Note that a temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment, making his VP the Acting President, does not cause a YES resolution, as Acting President is different from President under the Constitution.

para_P.title: If Kamala Harris is designated as President or Acting President before July 26, 2024, will Biden still be in office until the end of July 2024?

Assuming the following scenario: Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time prior to July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. This conclusion will rely on verified information from the US government or a consensus of reliable news sources.

Under these circumstances, is it accurate to say that Joe Biden continues to serve as US President until the conclusion of July 2024 (ET)? This is a YES if he remains in office, and a NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date. It is important to note that a temporary power shift under the 25th amendment, which appoints his Vice President as Acting President, does not result in a YES outcome, as the roles of Acting President and President are distinct according to the Constitution.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: If Joe Biden does not accept the Democratic nomination, will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP nominee?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. This statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

Given this situation, will Kamala Harris be nominated as the Democratic Vice Presidential candidate? The resolution is YES if Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. If someone else is selected as VP, the resolution is NO. Changes to the VP after the initial nomination do not affect the resolution.

question.title: Given Nvidia's market cap is larger than Apple's on July 17, 2024, will at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 17, 2024, the market capitalization of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

Then, will a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

Resolution criteria for this outcome: 
- This resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).
- This could be by signing a letter, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.
- All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.
- Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO.
- If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: On July 17, 2024, if Nvidia's market capitalization exceeds that of Apple, will a minimum of five identified Democratic House Members or US Senators urge Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20th?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market cap surpasses that of Apple according to Companies Market Cap, as verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

Will a coalition of at least five identified Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborate to request Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

Criteria for resolution of this scenario: 
- This will be marked as YES if a coalition of at least five identified Democratic Party US House Members/Senators collectively asks Joe Biden to consider ceasing his 2024 re-election campaign, or to press him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).
- This could occur through signing a letter, or in another manner such as a group engaging Biden in person and jointly requesting him to withdraw.
- All five individuals must be part of the same collective message. Five individuals separately expressing to reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw is insufficient for a YES resolution.
- Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden asking him to step aside will not fulfill this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are disclosed before the market's closing date. In any ambiguous situations where such names are reported but not confirmed with reasonable certainty, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.
- If these conditions are not satisfied before July 20th, this market will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: On July 17, 2024, if Nvidia's market capitalization exceeds that of Apple, will a minimum of five identified Democratic House Representatives or US Senators exert pressure on Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20th?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market cap is greater than Apple's according to Companies Market Cap, verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

Will a coalition of at least five identified Democratic Party House Representatives or US Senators collaborate to request Joe Biden to contemplate withdrawing from his 2024 re-election bid, or to strongly encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

Criteria for determining this outcome:

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games: (a) Sha'Carri Richardson wins a gold medal and (b) France places in the Top 5?
question.body:
This question resolves positively if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Sha'Carri Richardson wins a gold medal in any event during the 2024 Paris Olympic Games. Track and field events will start on Thursday, Aug. 1, and conclude on Sunday, Aug. 11. Sha'Carri Richardson is scheduled to compete on the following days:
- Women's 100m: Friday, Aug. 2, to Saturday, Aug. 3
- Women's 4x100m Relay (lineups not yet announced): Thursday, Aug. 8, to Friday, Aug. 9

(b) France places in the top 5 in the medal table at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:
1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

The question resolves ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

(b) France ranks in the top 5 on the medal table at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The medal table is determined by the total number of medals earned by each participating nation, ranked by:
1. Total Gold Medals
2. (In case of ties for 1) Total Silver Medals

question.title: Will GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will GUE/NGL secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if GUE/NGL secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and as **No** for all other political factions. In the event that two factions are equally positioned in terms of seats, both will be deemed as **Yes**.

The resolution of this question will be based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable news sources.
